# MarMoT Morphological Tagger

[http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/4/43/Marmota_flaviventris_%28Yellow_Bellied_Marmot%29%2C_Yosemite_NP_-_Diliff.jpg]

= Introduction =

MarMoT is a generic [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conditional_random_field Conditional Random Field] (CRF) framework as well as a state-of-the-art morphological tagger.


= Quickstart =

The most typical thing to do with MarMoT is to annotate words with their morphological properties. 

Given a file text.txt in a one-word-per-line format:
<pre>
Ich
mag
Murmeltiere
.

Murmeltiere
mögen
mich
.
</pre>

The following command:
<pre>
java -cp marmot.jar marmot.morph.cmd.Annotator\
 --model-file de.marmot\
 --test-file text.txt\
 --pred-file text.out.txt\
</pre>

While produce a file in (truncated) [http://ufal.mff.cuni.cz/conll2009-st/task-description.html CoNLL09] format:

<pre>
0	Ich	_	_	_	PPER	_	case=nom|number=sg|gender=*|person=1
1	mag	_	_	_	VMFIN	_	number=sg|person=1|tense=pres|mood=ind
2	Murmeltiere	_	_	_	NN	_	case=acc|number=pl|gender=neut
3	.	_	_	_	$.	_	_

0	Murmeltiere	_	_	_	NN	_	case=nom|number=pl|gender=masc
1	mögen	_	_	_	VMFIN	_	number=pl|person=3|tense=pres|mood=ind
2	mich	_	_	_	PPER	_	case=acc|number=sg|gender=*|person=1
3	.	_	_	_	$.	_	_
</pre>
